questions.question: Which layer serves as the foundation for the other layers in the network model?
Which of the following is NOT a type of guided transmission media?
The process of sending digital bits using analog signals is referred to as:
What is the primary purpose of the 'twists' in a twisted pair cable?
options: To increase the flexibility of the wire
To reduce electromagnetic interference and radiated signals
To increase the total length of the cable
To separate the positive and negative voltages
questions.answer: To reduce electromagnetic interference and radiated signals

questions.question: Which type of link allows for data transmission in both directions simultaneously?
What is the defining characteristic of a half-duplex link?
options: Transmission in only one fixed direction
Transmission in both directions, but not at the same time
Transmission using only one wire for both directions
questions.answer: Transmission in both directions, but not at the same time

questions.question: Which physical phenomenon is responsible for keeping light trapped inside a fiber optic core?
What is the typical core size of a single-mode fiber cable, used for long-distance transmission?
Which light source is typically paired with multi-mode fiber for shorter, cost-effective links?
Which wireless band is primarily utilized for wide-area broadcast and penetrates buildings well?
What is a significant disadvantage of wireless transmission compared to wired media?
options: Signals interfere and must be strictly managed
Limited to line-of-sight only at all frequencies
questions.answer: Signals interfere and must be strictly managed

questions.question: At what altitude do Geostationary (GEO) satellites orbit to appear stationary from Earth?
Which multiplexing technique divides the available transmission time on a medium among users?
What is a drawback of Synchronous TDM?
options: It is too complex to implement in digital systems
It wastes bandwidth if a device has no data to transmit during its slot
It requires different frequencies for every user
It only works with analog signals
questions.answer: It wastes bandwidth if a device has no data to transmit during its slot

questions.question: How does Statistical Time Division Multiplexing (STDM) improve efficiency over Synchronous TDM?
options: By only transmitting data from active workstations
By eliminating the need for addresses in the frame
By requiring all users to transmit at the same speed
questions.answer: By only transmitting data from active workstations

questions.question: Which technique is specifically an optical version of FDM used in fiber optic cables?
In Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA), how is a binary '0' typically transmitted?
options: As the mathematical inverse of the unique code
questions.answer: As the mathematical inverse of the unique code

questions.question: Which modulation technique is commonly used for each subchannel in Discrete Multitone (DMT) systems like DSL?
What is the primary benefit of data compression on a communications line?
options: It increases the security of the transmission
It reduces the transfer time for a given file size
It prevents signal attenuation over long distances
It allows the use of cheaper copper wires instead of fiber
questions.answer: It reduces the transfer time for a given file size
